briefdescription.para: A copy of the latest tracked hand data; never null, never warped.
An unwarped copy of _handData (if unwarping is necessary; otherwise identical). Only relevant when using the Leap Graphical Renderer to create curved user interfaces.
Will be null when not tracked, otherwise contains the same data as _handData.
If the hand data mode for this InteractionHand is set to Custom, you must also manually specify the provider from which to retrieve Leap frames containing hand data.
If the hand data mode for this InteractionHand is set to Custom, you must manually specify how this InteractionHand should retrieve a specific Hand data object from a Leap frame.
Gets whether the underlying Leap hand is currently tracked.
Gets whether the underlying Leap hand is currently being moved in worldspace.
Gets the last tracked state of the Leap hand.

detaileddescription.para: Note for those using the Leap Graphical Renderer: If the hand required warping due to the nearby presence of an object in warped (curved) space, this will return the hand as warped from that object's curved space into the rectilinear space containing its colliders. This is only relevant if you are using the Leap Graphical Renderer to render curved, interactive objects.

briefdescription.para: Gets whether the underlying tracked Leap hand is a left hand.
Gets the last-tracked position of the underlying Leap hand.
Gets the last-tracked rotation of the underlying Leap hand.
Gets the velocity of the underlying tracked Leap hand.
Gets the controller type of this InteractionControllerBase. InteractionHands are Interaction Engine controllers implemented over Leap hands.
Returns this InteractionHand object. This property will be null if the InteractionControllerBase is not ControllerType.Hand.
Handles logic determining whether a hand has grabbed or released an interaction object.

memberdef.name: enabledPrimaryHoverFingertips
memberdef.initializer: = new bool[5] { true, true, true, false, false }

briefdescription.para: Set slots to true to consider the corresponding finger's fingertip for primary hover checks. 0 is the thumb, 1 is the index finger, etc. Generally speaking, enable the fingertips you'd like users to be able to use to choose and push a button, but keep in mind you pay distance check costs for each fingertip enabled!

This method is called by the InteractionController when it is notified by the InteractionManager that an InteractionBehaviour has been unregistered from the Interaction Engine. If your controller has any state that remembers or tracks interaction objects, this method should clear that state, because unregistered objects won't receive state updates or callbacks from this controller's Interaction Manager anymore.
Called just before the InteractionController proceeds with its usual FixedUpdate.

detaileddescription.para: It's generally better to override this method instead of having your InteractionController implement FixedUpdate because its execution order relative to the Interaction Manager is fixed.

briefdescription.para: Implementing this method is necessary to support curved spaces as rendered by a Leap Graphic Renderer. See InteractionHand for an example implementation. (Implementing this method is optional if you are not using a curved space as rendered by a Leap Graphic Renderer.)

detaileddescription.para: Warps the collider transforms of this controller by the inverse of the transformation that is applied on the provided warpedSpaceElement, using the primaryHoverPoint as the pivot transform for the transformation.
ITransformer.WorldSpaceUnwarp is a useful method here. (ISpaceComponents contain references to their transformers via their anchors.)

ISpaceComponents denote game objects whose visual positions are warped from rectilinear (non-warped) space into a curved space (via, for example, a LeapCylindricalSpace, which can only be rendered correctly by the Leap Graphic Renderer). This method reverses that transformation for the hand, bringing it into the object's rectilinear space, allowing objects curved in this way to correctly collide with the bones in the hand or collider of a held controller.
The provided Transform is the closest primary hover point to any given primary hover candidate, so it is used as the pivot point for unwarping the colliders of this InteractionController.

memberdef.argsstring: (int contactBoneIndex, out Vector3 targetPosition, out Quaternion targetRotation)
memberdef.name: getColliderBoneTargetPositionRotation

briefdescription.para: If your controller features no moving colliders relative to itself, simply return the desired position and rotation for the given indexed contact bone in the contactBones array. (For example, by recording the local position and local rotation of each contact bone in initContact()). More complex controllers, such as InteractionHand, uses this method to set ContactBone target positions and rotations based on the tracked Leap hand.
Called to initialize contact colliders. See remarks for implementation requirements.

detaileddescription.para:
initContact() should:
Return false at any time if initialization cannot be performed.
Ensure the "contactBones" property returns all contact colliders.
(Construct contact colliders if they don't already exist.)
Ensure the "contactBoneParent" property returns the common parent of all contact colliders.
(Construct the contact bone parent if it doesn't already exist.)
Return true if initialization was successful.
Contact will only begin updating after initialization succeeds, otherwise it will try to initialize again on the next fixed frame.
After initialization, the contact bone parent's layer will be set to the Interaction Manager's contactBoneLayer.

briefdescription.para: Optionally override this method to perform logic just before soft contact is enabled for this controller.

detaileddescription.para: The InteractionHand implementation takes the opportunity to reset its contact bone's joints, which may have initialized slightly out of alignment on initial construction.

briefdescription.para: Optionally override this method to perform logic just after soft contact is disabled for this controller.

detaileddescription.para: The InteractionHand implementation takes the opportunity to reset its contact bone's joints, which my have initialized slightly out of alignment on initial construction.

briefdescription.para: Attempts to manually initiate a grasp on the argument interaction object. A grasp will only begin if a finger and thumb are both in contact with the interaction object. If this method successfully initiates a grasp, it will return true, otherwise it will return false.
Called every fixed frame if grasping is enabled in the Interaction Manager.

detaileddescription.para: graspActivityManager.ActiveObjects will contain objects around the hoverPoint within the grasping radius in other words, objects eligible to be grasped by the controller. Refer to it to avoid checking grasp eligibility against all graspable objects in your scene.

briefdescription.para: Optionally override this method to perform logic just before a grasped object is released because it is no longer eligible to be grasped by this controller or ReleaseGrasp() was manually called on the controller.
Returns whether this controller should release an object this fixed frame, and if so, sets objectToRelease to the object the controller should release.
Returns whether this controller should grasp an object this fixed frame, and if so, sets objectToGrasp to the object the controller should grasp.

memberdef.argsstring: (Leap.Hand hand, out Vector3 targetPosition, out Quaternion targetRotation)
memberdef.name: BoneMapFunc

memberdef.argsstring: (Leap.Bone bone, GameObject contactBoneObj, int boneArrayIndex, Collider boneCollider)
memberdef.name: initContactBone

briefdescription.para: Reconnects and resets all the joints in the hand.
A utility function that sets a Hand object's bones based on this InteractionHand. Can be used to display a graphical hand that matches the physical one.
Returns approximately where the controller is grasping the currently-grasped InteractionBehaviour. Specifically, returns the average position of all grasping fingertips of the InteractionHand.

detaileddescription.para: This method will print an error if the hand is not currently grasping an object.

briefdescription.para: Seamlessly swap the currently grasped object for a replacement object. It will behave like the hand released the current object, and then grasped the new object.

detaileddescription.para: This method will not teleport the replacement object or move it in any way, it will just cause it to be grasped. That means that you will be responsible for moving the replacement object into a reasonable position for it to be grasped.
